abstract: United Nations Memo; Israel's successful bid to United Nations General Assembly to hold first-ever meeting to discuss the rise of global anti-Semitism is supported by host of nations, including all members of European Union; some leaders use opportunity to smooth relations with Israel that had been strained by Europe's tough stance with nation over Palestinian cause.
lead_paragraph: The United Nations General Assembly on Thursday agreed to a bid by Israel to host a first-ever meeting devoted to the rise of anti-Semitism worldwide.
snippet: The United Nations General Assembly on Thursday agreed to a bid by Israel to host a first-ever meeting devoted to the rise of anti-Semitism worldwide.

headline.main: Modest Victory for Israel in Quest for International Meeting on Anti-Semitism
headline.print_headline: Modest Victory for Israel in Quest for International Meeting on Anti-Semitism
